task.title: Deleting an messaging user by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete messaging users by using the user delete command on the command line.

taskbody.context: You can delete an messaging user by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete an messaging user, see .

step.cmd: To delete an messaging user, enter the following command:
step.info:
The command must be capitalized as shown.
user delete "UserID=UserID" "Type=Messaging"Where:
UserID Specifies the user ID of the messaging user to delete.

taskbody.example: The following example shows deleting the messaging user TEST: user delete "UserID=TEST" "Type=Messaging" The user has been deleted successfully.
